description: Telegram, the messaging app, has been removed from Apple’s app store days after Theresa May singled it out for criticism as a haven for criminals and terrorist
text:
The Telegram app was removed from the Apple store after the company said it had found “inappropriate content” Dado Ruvic/Reuters
Telegram, the messaging app, has been removed from Apple’s app store days after Theresa May singled it out for criticism as a haven for criminals and terrorists.
Pavel Durov, the app’s co-founder, said on Twitter that Apple had found “inappropriate content” was available to users. Both the original Telegram and a new, updated version called Telegram X were removed.
Mr Durov, 33, added: “Once we have protections in place we expect the apps to be back on the App Store.”
Speaking at the World Economic Forum, the prime minister said last Wednesday: “Smaller platforms can quickly become home to criminals and terrorists. We have seen that happen with Telegram. And we need to see more co-operation from smaller platforms like this. No one wants to…
title: Apple removes Telegram app accused of being haven for terrorists
